result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Khalem Marquell Gaston

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Khalem Marquell Gaston appeared by video.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Khalem Marquell Gaston.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense further advises that they are now in a resolution posture. Case adjourned for a plea hearing to Br 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-11-2022

Defendant Khalem Marquell Gaston appeared by video from Justice Point.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt appeared by video for Khalem Marquell Gaston.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Present by video is Justice Point Case Worker Sheridan Heckel.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant to continue meeting with Justice Point, no use of controlled substances without a prescription, no THC and no driving.  No action taken at this time.    Case remains calendared for *Scheduling Conference on October 12, 2022 in Branch 16.

Defendant Khalem Marquell Gaston in court, appear by vido with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Ayala.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 072364,
Payable Number: 1023062,
Receipt Number: 22RP030670,
Amount: $20.00
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No driving during pendency of case.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Actor Tyjerious T Young

Defendant Khalem Marquell Gaston in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Defendant Khalem Marquell Gaston in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Khalem Marquell Gaston appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT HAS RETAINED PRIVATE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
